unified_data.title: Financial Technology (Fintech) Innovations Specialization
unified_data.description: This specialization from Coursera explores the rapidly evolving world of Financial Technology (Fintech) Innovations. It covers key concepts like blockchain, cryptocurrency, payment systems, and smart investing. You will learn about emerging technologies and their impact on the financial industry.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of finance concepts is recommended. No prior programming experience is required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Gain knowledge of Fintech innovations, including blockchain, cryptocurrency, and payment systems. Understand the impact of these technologies on financial markets and learn about smart investing strategies.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit. Paid certificate available.

unified_data.title: Fintech: Foundations & Applications of Financial Technology Specialization
unified_data.description: Offered by the University of Pennsylvania, this Specialization explores the foundations and applications of Fintech, covering topics like blockchain, cryptocurrencies, and investment management. It examines the impact of technology on financial services. Includes hands-on projects.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of business concepts and a high school diploma. No prior finance or programming experience is required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand Fintech fundamentals. Explore blockchain, cryptocurrencies, and investment management. Analyze the impact of technology on financial services and gain practical skills through projects.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit. Paid Certificate Available.

unified_data.price: Free to Audit. Paid Certificate Available.

original_data.Title: FinTech: Foundations, Payments, and Regulations
original_data.Short Intro: In this course, you’ll learn the key components of modern-day investment strategies which utilize fintech. Professors Natasha Sarin and Chris Geczy  of the Wharton School have designed this course to help you understand the complex structure of  payment methods and financial regulations, so you can determine how fintech plays a role in the future of investing. Through analysis of robo-advising and changing demographic forces, you’ll learn how basic elements of trust underlie complex choice architecture in investments and impact investing. You’ll also explore payment methodologies and how fintech is emerging as an entrepreneurial solution to both investments and payment systems. By the end of this course, you’ll be able to identify different financial technologies, and understand the dynamic between the innovations and regulations,  and  employ best practices in developing a fintech strategy for yourself or your business. No prerequisites are required for this course, although a basic understanding of credit cards and other payment methods is helpful.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), Vietnamese, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.learning_outcomes: Identify financial technologies, understand the interplay between innovation and regulation, and apply best practices to develop a fintech strategy for personal or business use.

original_data.Title: FinTech Law and Policy
original_data.Short Intro: Being a successful FinTech firm requires more than just great technology; it also requires an understanding of the laws and regulations applicable to your business. This course will provide you with that understanding. You will learn about the critical legal, regulatory, and policy issues associated with cryptocurrencies, initial coin offerings, online lending, new payments and wealth management technologies, and financial account aggregators.  In addition, you will learn how regulatory agencies in the U.S. are continually adjusting to the emergence of new financial technologies and how one specific agency has proposed a path for FinTech firms to become regulated banks. You will also learn the basics of how banks are regulated in the U.S.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: FinTech Law and Policy

This course will provide you with that understanding. You will learn about the critical legal, regulatory, and policy issues associated with cryptocurrencies, initial coin offerings, online lending, new payments and wealth management technologies, and financial account aggregators.  In addition, you will learn how regulatory agencies in the U.S. are continually adjusting to the emergence of new financial technologies and how one specific agency has proposed a path for FinTech firms to become regulated banks. You will also learn the basics of how banks are regulated in the U.S.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business concepts is helpful.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand critical legal and regulatory issues in FinTech. Learn about cryptocurrencies, online lending, and bank regulations. Analyze how regulatory agencies adapt to new financial technologies.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit, Paid Certificate Available

original_data.Title: Banking and Financial Institutions
original_data.Short Intro: The purpose of this course is to provide you with a basic understanding of the connections between money, the financial system, and the broader macroeconomy. We will examine the economics of modern financial institutions (e.g. banks), including how they are organized, the products and financial services they offer, the risks they take, why and how they are regulated, and how this has changed over time. We will develop a conceptual framework that will allow us to assess how recent financial regulations as well as innovations in finance (e.g., securitization, fintech, cryptocurrencies) may influence the macroeconomic, financial, and business environment.

unified_data.title: Banking and Financial Institutions
unified_data.description: The purpose of this course is to provide you with a basic understanding of the connections between money, the financial system, and the broader macroeconomy. We will develop a conceptual framework that will allow us to assess how recent financial regulations as well as innovations in finance (e.g., securitization, fintech, cryptocurrencies) may influence the macroeconomic, financial, and business environment.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of economics is recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand the economics of financial institutions, their products, and services. Analyze financial regulations and innovations like fintech and cryptocurrencies. Assess their impact on the macroeconomic and business environment.
unified_data.price: Free (with audit option) or Paid (for certificate)

original_data.Title: FinTech Risk Management
original_data.Short Intro: This course “FinTech Risk Management” help you understand risk management and corporate governance in finance industry with the disruption by FinTech and RegTech. You will become more confident to analyse and make recommendations to develop business strategies balancing the risks in operation, reputation and the stability of finance firms.

original_data.Title: FinTech Disruptive Innovation: Implications for Society
original_data.Short Intro: This course “FinTech Disruptive Innovation: Implications for Society” help you understand how disruptive innovations create opportunity in finance industry and its impact to society especially your career. You would be able to examine and analyse how FinTech innovations would affect companies that relates to FinTech services and how it might affect your career in finance.

original_data.Title: Cryptocurrency and Blockchain: An Introduction to Digital Currencies
original_data.Short Intro: What is Cryptocurrency and how is it an innovative and effective method of currency? This course was designed for individuals and organizations who want to learn how to navigate investment in cryptocurrencies. Professors Jessica Wachter and Sarah Hammer will guide you through developing a framework for understanding both Cryptocurrency and Blockchain. You’ll learn how to define a currency, analyze the foundations of digital signatures and blockchain technology in cryptocurrency, and accurately assess the risks of cryptocurrency in a modern investment portfolio. By the end of this course, you’ll have a deep understanding of the realities of Cryptocurrency, the intricacies of Blockchain technology, and an effective strategy for incorporating Cryptocurrency into your investment plans. No prerequisites are required, although "Fintech: Foundations, Payments, and Regulations"  from Wharton's Fintech Specialization is recommended.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), Vietnamese, Russian, English, Spanish

original_data.Title: FinTech Security and Regulation (RegTech)
original_data.Short Intro: This course "FinTech Security and Regulation (RegTech)" help you to understand RegTech and to become more confident and persuasive in your ability to analyze and make recommendations to executives within the finance industry regarding how to react to these changes, e.g. Regulations to cryptocurrencies like BitCoin & Initial Coin Offering (ICO). It presents the views of several professors from the top business school in Asia as well as perspectives from industry professionals.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Chinese (Simplified), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: FinTech Security and Regulation (RegTech)
unified_data.description: This course "FinTech Security and Regulation (RegTech)" help you to understand RegTech and to become more confident and persuasive in your ability to analyze and make recommendations to executives within the finance industry regarding how to react to these changes, e.g. Regulations to cryptocurrencies like BitCoin & Initial Coin Offering (ICO). It presents the views of several professors from the top business school in Asia as well as perspectives from industry professionals.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of finance and business concepts.
No prior experience with FinTech is required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, you will understand RegTech and be able to analyze and recommend actions to executives regarding financial industry changes, particularly those related to cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and ICOs.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit, Paid Certificate Available

original_data.Title: Lending, Crowdfunding, and Modern Investing
original_data.Short Intro: In this course, you’ll learn the foundational theories behind robo-advising, crowdfunding, and marketplace lending, and how to apply these theories to optimize your investments. Professor David Musto of the Wharton School has designed this course to help you gain a practical understanding of the theoretical frameworks of Modern Portfolio Theory and Financial Technology. You’ll learn how to apply the ideas behind robo-advising and crowdfunding to better assess and leverage a more optimized portfolio while managing risks. You’ll also explore the current consumer credit landscape and learn how to utilize financial technologies in your business. You’ll analyze real-life examples by studying the cases of Square and CommonBond. By the end of this course, you’ll have honed your skills in calculating risks and returns in robo-advising and crowdfunding, and be able to assess the value of marketplace lending to achieve better returns on your investments. No prerequisites are required for this course, although "Fintech: Foundations, Payments, and Regulations" and "Cryptocurrency and Blockchain: An Introduction to Digital Currencies" from Wharton's Fintech Specialization are recommended.

unified_data.title: Lending, Crowdfunding, and Modern Investing

unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand robo-advising, crowdfunding, and marketplace lending theories. Apply these theories to optimize investments, assess risks, and build a better portfolio. Analyze real-life examples and evaluate marketplace lending.

original_data.Title: Application of AI, InsurTech, and Real Estate Technology
original_data.Short Intro: In this course, you’ll learn about the emerging technologies in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning that are utilized in InsurTech and Real Estate Tech. Professor Chris Geczy of the Wharton School has designed this course to help you navigate the complex world of insurance and real estate tech, and understand how FinTech plays a role in the future of the industry. Through study and analysis of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, you’ll learn how InsurTech is redefining the insurance industry. You’ll also explore classifications of insurtech companies and the size of the InsurTech, Real Estate Tech, and AI markets. You will also explore  FinTech specialties with Warren Pennington from Vanguard. By the end of this course, you’ll be able to identify emerging technologies of AI, Machine Learning, and Financial Technologies from a variety of insurance and real estate tech companies and their impact in the future of finance and investments.

unified_data.title: Application of AI, InsurTech, and Real Estate Technology

learning_outcomes: Identify emerging AI, Machine Learning, and Financial Technologies in InsurTech and Real Estate Tech.
Understand how InsurTech is redefining the insurance industry.
Analyze the impact of these technologies on finance and investments.

original_data.Title: Supply Chain Finance Market and Fintech Ecosystem
original_data.Short Intro: This course provides an in-depth understanding of the Supply Chain Finance market including insights on the potential and current market size, market penetration, growth, and distribution. You’ll be introduced to the four distinctive groups serving the Supply Chain Finance market and learn about the main stakeholders and market participants in a Supply Chain Finance program. By the end of the course, you’ll have reviewed the key trends and upcoming risks affecting Supply Chain Finance and gained a deeper understanding of the key challenges in the market amongst corporate clients, banks, non-bank financiers and technology service providers.
original_data.Skills: Marketing Supply Chain Finance Services,Risk Management of Supply Chain Finance,

original_data.Title: FinTech and the Transformation in Financial Services
original_data.Short Intro: The FinTech revolution is rapidly transforming the financial industry. The use of digital technologies is the norm, and together with regulatory and market changes it is creating a revolution. After completion of the module, you'll be able to: describe the changes that influence the financial sector, understand the complexity of the payment infrastructure, identify and explain the key payment instruments and how they function, understand the types of money that exits, and recognize changes in the regulatory frameworks and how they inhibit or promote innovation.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish
